channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-14397] Queries ran after reopening of tez session launches additional sessions
item.description:
Say we have configured hive.server2.tez.default.queues with 2 queues q1 and q2 with default expiry interval of 5 mins.

After 5 mins of non-usage the sessions corresponding to queues q1 and q2 will be expired. When new set of queries are issue after this expiry, the default sessions backed by q1 and q2 and reopened again. Now when we run more queries the reopened sessions are not used instead new session is opened.
At this point there will be 4 sessions running (2 abandoned sessions and 2 current sessions).
item.summary: Queries ran after reopening of tez session launches additional sessions

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: sseth/sershe Can someone plz review this patch?

Which part of the patch fixes the problem where "when we run more queries the reopened sessions are not used instead new session is opened"?
Queue name logic makes sense to me

sershe The root cause of this bug is this code
https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/master/ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/exec/tez/TezSessionPoolManager.java#L275-L287

If the queue name is set in conf then it always creates a new session when getSession is invoked.

The part that fixes this is conf.unset("tez.queue.name"). This makes sure we use the sessions from the pool when available.

The other part of the patch

conf.set(TezConfiguration.TEZ_QUEUE_NAME, sessionState.getQueueName());

is required to reopen the initial sessions when user specified queue name is not available. If we don't set this then all the reopened sessions will use "default" queue.
